fields.description:
*index. xml*

<TextField left="0" paddingLeft="10dp" autocorrect="false" autocapitalization="Titanium.UI.TEXT_AUTOCAPITALIZATION_ALL" right="0" paddingRight="10dp" maxLength="40" hintTextColor="#d9d9d9" hintText="Enter company id" backgroundColor="transparent" id="companyid" class="textField" height="40dp" ></TextField>/TextField>

It works fine in the Simulator (Geny Motion), but when I try the same on Android Device, it fails. I tried it on Samsung S4, Nexus 4, Nexus 5x and few more android devices.

I hope the issue is clear, autocapitalization is not working at all. I would request you to please provide me a solution ASAP.

comments.body:
Hello, I can't reproduce the issue with SDK 6.1.1.GA. I am testing on Samsung J7 with Android 6.0.1.

The textfield input is always showing in capital letter, even if I change it to small letter in keypad. Thanks.

Hi Sharif,

You have used an higher SDK that is the reason, you are not able to reproduce the issue. I have mentioned the SDK that I am using and facing the issue. I hope if you use the SDK and not the latest one you will get the bug reproduces.

Their is nothing in the documentation that states that this property would work on the latest SDK only. So it would be really helpful, if you try to replicate the issue using the environment I have mentioned above. 

Also before closing any ticket you should have confirmation of the person how raised it. As you don't have any option to reopen the issue.

Thanks
